acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

cancelRequestDeposit().details: Unusable when paused. Protected by whenNotPaused.It can only be called in the same epoch.

claimSharesAndRequestRedeem(uint256).details: if claimable == 0, it has the same behavior as requestRedeem function.if claimable > 0, user shares follow this path: vault --> user ; user --> pendingSilo

claimSharesOnBehalf(address[]).details: Iterates over each controller address, checks for claimable deposits, and deposits them on their behalf.

params.controllers: The list of controller addresses for which to claim shares.

returns.assets: The assets that can be claimed.

returns.shares: The shares that can be redeemed.

close(uint256).details: Users can still requestDeposit but it can't be settled.

convertToAssets(uint256,uint256).details: Converts shares to assets for a specific epoch.

params.requestId: The request ID, which is equivalent to the epoch ID.

deposit(uint256,address).details: Unusable when paused. Protected by ERC20PausableUpgradeable's _transfer function.

params.assets: The amount of assets requested to deposit.

deposit(uint256,address,address).details: Unusable when paused. Protected by ERC20PausableUpgradeable's _transfer function.

params.controller: The controller, who owns the deposit request.

feeRates().details: Since we have a cooldown period and to avoid a double call to update the feeRates, this function returns a different rate following the timestamp

getRolesStorage().details: Returns the storage struct of the roles.

returns._rolesStorage: The storage struct of the roles.

params.data: The encoded initialization parameters of the vault.

initiateClosing().details: we make sure that initiate closing will make an epoch changement if the variable newTotalAssets is "defined"(!= type(uint256).max). This guarantee that no userShares will be locked in a pending state.

returns._0: True if the whitelist is activated, false otherwise

params.account: The address of the account to check

returns._0: True if the account is whitelisted, false otherwise

maxDeposit(address).details: If the contract is paused no deposit/claims are possible.

maxMint(address).details: If the contract is paused no deposit/claims are possible.We read the claimableDepositRequest of the controller then convert it to shares using the convertToShares of the related epochId

returns._0: The maximum amount of shares to get.

maxRedeem(address).details: When the vault is closed, users may claim there assets (erc7540.redeem style) or redeem there assets in a sync manner. this is why when they have nothing to claim and the vault is closed, we return their shares balance

maxWithdraw(address).details: This is the same philosophy as maxRedeem, except that we take care to convertToAssets the value before returning it

returns._0: The maximum amount of assets to get.

mint(uint256,address).details: Unusable when paused. Protected by ERC20PausableUpgradeable's _transfer function.

mint(uint256,address,address).details: Unusable when paused. Protected by ERC20PausableUpgradeable's _transfer function.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

returns.assets: The assets that are waiting to be settled.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

returns.shares: The shares that are waiting to be settled.

redeem(uint256,address,address).details: Unusable when paused.First _withdraw path: whenNotPaused via ERC20Pausable._update.Second _withdraw path: whenNotPaused in ERC7540.

params.controller: The controller, who owns the redeem request.
params.shares: The amount shares to convert into assets.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.assets: The amount of assets to deposit.
params.controller: The address of the controller involved in the deposit request.
params.owner: The address of the owner for whom the deposit is requested.

params.assets: The amount of assets to deposit.
params.controller: The address of the controller involved in the deposit request.
params.owner: The address of the owner for whom the deposit is requested.
params.referral: The address who referred the deposit.

params.controller: The address of the controller involved in the redemption request.
params.owner: The address of the token owner requesting redemption.
params.shares: The number of tokens to redeem.

returns.requestId: The id of the redeem request.

params.accounts: The addresses of the accounts to remove

setOperator(address,bool).details: should not be usable when contract is paused

settleDeposit(uint256).details: Unusable when paused, protected by whenNotPaused in _updateTotalAssets.

settleRedeem(uint256).details: Unusable when paused, protected by whenNotPaused in _updateTotalAssets.After updating totalAssets, it takes fees, updates highWaterMark and finally settles redeem requests.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

updateFeeReceiver(address).details: Only the owner can call this function.

params._feeReceiver: The new address of the fee receiver.

params._newTotalAssets: The new total assets of the vault.

updateValuationManager(address).details: Only the owner can call this function.

params._valuationManager: The new address of the valuation manager.

updateWhitelistManager(address).details: Only the owner can call this function.

params._whitelistManager: The new address of the whitelist manager.

withdraw(uint256,address,address).details: Unusable when paused.First _withdraw path: whenNotPaused via ERC20Pausable._update.Second _withdraw path: whenNotPaused in ERC7540.

addToWhitelist(address[]).notice: Adds multiple accounts to the whitelist

claimSharesAndRequestRedeem(uint256).notice: Function to bundle a claim of shares and a request redeem. It can be convenient for UX.

claimSharesOnBehalf(address[]).notice: Claims all available shares for a list of controller addresses.

claimableDepositRequest(uint256,address).notice: Returns the claimable deposit request for a controller for a specific request ID.

claimableRedeemRequest(uint256,address).notice: Returns the claimable redeem request for a controller for a specific request ID.

close(uint256).notice: Closes the vault, only redemption and withdrawal are allowed after this. Can only be called by the safe.

convertToShares(uint256,uint256).notice: Converts assets to shares for a specific epoch.

deposit(uint256,address).notice: Claim the assets from the vault after a request has been settled.

deposit(uint256,address,address).notice: Claim the assets from the vault after a request has been settled.

highWaterMark().notice: value of the high water mark, the highest price per share ever reached

initiateClosing().notice: Initiates the closing of the vault. Can only be called by the owner.

isWhitelistActivated().notice: Returns if the whitelist is activated

isWhitelisted(address).notice: Checks if an account is whitelisted

lastFeeTime().notice: the time of the last fee calculation

maxDeposit(address).notice: Returns the amount of assets a controller will get if he redeem.

maxMint(address).notice: Returns the amount of sharres a controller will get if he calls Deposit.

maxRedeem(address).notice: Returns the maximum redeemable shares for a controller.

maxWithdraw(address).notice: Returns the amount of assets a controller will get if he redeem.

mint(uint256,address,address).notice: Claim shares from the vault after a request deposit.

pause().notice: Halts core operations of the vault. Can only be called by the owner.Core operations include deposit, redeem, withdraw, any type of request, settles deposit and redeem and newTotalAssets update.

pendingDepositRequest(uint256,address).notice: Returns the amount of assets that are pending to be deposited for a controller. For a specific request ID.

pendingRedeemRequest(uint256,address).notice: Returns the pending redeem request for a controller.

redeem(uint256,address,address).notice: Claim assets from the vault. After a request is made and settled.

requestDeposit(uint256,address,address,a.notice: Requests a deposit of assets, subject to whitelist validation.

requestRedeem(uint256,address,address).notice: Requests the redemption of tokens, subject to whitelist validation.

revokeFromWhitelist(address[]).notice: Removes multiple accounts from the whitelist

settleDeposit(uint256).notice: Settles deposit requests, integrates user funds into the vault strategy, and enables share claims. If possible, it also settles redeem requests.

settleRedeem(uint256).notice: Settles redeem requests, only callable by the safe.

unpause().notice: Resumes core operations of the vault. Can only be called by the owner.

updateFeeReceiver(address).notice: Updates the address of the fee receiver.

updateNewTotalAssets(uint256).notice: Function to propose a new valuation for the vault.It can only be called by the ValueManager.

updateRates((uint16,uint16)).notice: update the fee rates, the new rates will be applied after the cooldown period

updateValuationManager(address).notice: Updates the address of the valuation manager.

updateWhitelistManager(address).notice: Updates the address of the whitelist manager.
